```{r}
# Get the Data

# Read in with tidytuesdayR package 
# Install from CRAN via: install.packages("tidytuesdayR")
# This loads the readme and all the datasets for the week of interest

# Either ISO-8601 date or year/week works!
library(tidyverse)
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2023-05-02')
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2023, week = 18)

plots <- tuesdata$plots
species <- tuesdata$species
surveys <- tuesdata$surveys
```

### Assignment 
```{r}
mice_count_by_year <- surveys %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  count()
mice_count_by_sex <- surveys %>%
  group_by(year,sex) %>%
  count()
mice_count_by_species <- surveys %>%
  group_by(year,species) %>%
  count()
```


```{r}
ggplot(mice_count_by_year,aes(x=year, y=n))+
  geom_line()+
  ggtitle("Mice collected per year")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))


```


### Sex per year
```{r}
ggplot(mice_count_by_sex ,aes(x=year, y=n, color= sex))+
  geom_line()+
  ggtitle("Mice sex per year")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))
```
```{r}
ggplot(mice_count_by_species ,aes(x=year, y=n, color= species))+
  geom_line()+
  ggtitle("Mice species per year")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))
```
```{r}
ggplot(mice_count_by_species ,aes(x=year, y=n, color= species))+
  geom_line()+
  ggtitle("Mice species per year")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))
```
